Identify and arrange shape descriptors

Source: R/internal_builders.R
shapes_mat.Rd

Identify data type (Fourier coefficients or Procrustes shape coordinates) and arrange them in 2-margin matrix format, suitable to be used as input for multivariate analysis. Used internally.

shapes_mat(shapes)

Arguments

shapes

Shape data.

Value

A list of length 2 containing:

  • $datype: the type of geometric morphometrics data.

  • $data2d: the shape descriptors arranged in 2-margins matrix format.

Examples

#apply on shells dataset
data("shells")
dat1 <- shapes_mat(shells$shapes)

#inspect results
head(dat1$data2d)
#>           A1          A2         A3            A4         A5            A6

#aply on tails dataset
data("tails")
dat2 <- shapes_mat(tails$shapes)

#inspect results
head(dat2$data2d)
